remarks: In a Moore system whose closure operator has the exchange property, if ` S ` is independent and contained in the closure of ` T ` , and either ` S ` or ` T ` is finite, then ` T ` dominates ` S ` .  This is an immediate consequence of ~ mreexexd .  (Contributed by David Moews, 1-May-2017.)
statement:
mreexdomd.1 $e |- ( ph -> A e. ( Moore ` X ) ) $.
mreexdomd.2 $e |- N = ( mrCls ` A ) $.
mreexdomd.3 $e |- I = ( mrInd ` A ) $.
mreexdomd.4 $e |- ( ph -> A. s e. ~P X A. y e. X A. z e. ( ( N ` ( s u. { y } ) ) \ ( N ` s ) ) y e. ( N ` ( s u. { z } ) ) ) $.
mreexdomd.5 $e |- ( ph -> S C_ ( N ` T ) ) $.
mreexdomd.6 $e |- ( ph -> T C_ X ) $.
mreexdomd.7 $e |- ( ph -> ( S e. Fin \/ T e. Fin ) ) $.
mreexdomd.8 $e |- ( ph -> S e. I ) $.
mreexdomd $p |- ( ph -> S ~<_ T ) $.
